meanings.definition: In a manner intended to stop something from happening before it occurs.
meanings.sent1: She acted preventively by locking the door before leaving the house.
meanings.sent2: The doctor advised taking vitamins preventively to avoid getting sick.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel preventively stored nuts for the winter, just in case.
meanings.sent4: The teacher preventively prepared extra materials for the class in case of technical issues.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter sprayed water preventively around the forest to avoid wildfires.

meanings.definition: Acting to prevent or hinder something from happening.
meanings.sent1: The preventive measures taken by the security guard were effective.
meanings.sent2: The preventively installed alarm system alerted the homeowners of the break-in.
meanings.sent3: The preventively placed cones guided the traffic away from the construction zone.
meanings.sent4: The preventively trained dog barked at any potential intruders.
meanings.sent5: The preventively scheduled maintenance kept the machinery running smoothly.
